vehicle module¶

class vehicle.Car(x, y, road, length=1)¶

Bases: Vehicle

draw_image(painter: QPainter, d_theta: float, radius: int, center: QPoint, z: float)¶

Draws the image linked to the Car object on the road at its location.

Parameters:

  • painter – Container painter

  • d_theta – Increment in angle for a gap of one unit in the road array

  • radius – Radius of the circular road

  • center – Point that represents the center of the circular road

  • z – Zooming factor scaling according to the road length

Returns:

Nothing

Author:

Clément Vellu

draw_rect(painter: QPainter, d_theta: float, radius: int, center: QPoint, z: float)¶

Draws a rectangle at the position of the Car object on the road. The faster the Car goes, the greener the rectangle is.

Parameters:

  • painter – Container painter

  • d_theta – Increment in angle for a gap of one unit in the road array

  • radius – Radius of the circular road

  • center – Point that represents the center of the circular road

  • z – Zooming factor scaling according to the road length

Returns:

Nothing

Author:

Clément Vellu

class vehicle.Vehicle(x: int, y: int, road: Road, length: int)¶

Bases: ABC

calculate_accel(leader: Vehicle) → float¶

Calculates the acceleration of the vehicle using the Intelligent Driver Model (IDM). Called by Vehicle.update_speed.

Parameters:

leader – Vehicle that is ahead

Returns:

new_accel: Calculated acceleration

Author:

Clément Vellu

change_lane(dest_lane)¶

NOT IMPLEMENTED - Changes the lane of the vehicle to the dest_lane.

Parameters:

dest_lane – Lane that the driver wants to reach

Returns:

Nothing

Author:

None yet

get_gap(leader: Vehicle) → int¶

Calculates the gap between two vehicles assuming the given vehicle is ahead and return the absolute value of it.

Parameters:

leader – Other vehicle

Returns:

gap - The value of the gap between the vehicle 1 and the vehicle 2

Author:

Mipam Quici

id = 10¶
update_speed(leader: Vehicle, dt: float) → None¶

Updates the speed of the vehicle using the ballistic method.

Parameters:

  • leader – Vehicle that is ahead.

  • dt – Time increment used in simulation

Returns:

Nothing

Author:

Clément Vellu
